com.unvired.lib.utility

Class Structure

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.unvired.lib.utility.Structure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Structure
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Structure is a utility class that is used to describe the properties of a Header or Item in a Business Entity. It is a collection of key value pairs (Field Name, Field Value).
    In database terminology is it equivalent to a single row of data in a table with column names and corresponding values

    A Structure has the following properties:
    1. Name - Unique ID used to identify one Structure from another
    2. Type - A code used to indicate if the structure is to be interpreted as a Header or Item. It can have one of two values (1 - Header, 0 - Item)
    3. Fields - A collection of (key, value) pairs corresponding to the properties of the header or item
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
